text: [Music]
hello my name is Kalyan cutter and I am
a senior product manager with Amazon s3
I'm here today to share Amazon s3
features that you can use to organize
the data in meaningful ways in order to
meet business organizational security or
compliance requirements around your
store data Amazon s3 is not just a
Soviet service it is a new way to think
about and organize your data so that it
works for you and your organization but
Amazon s3 you can now organize the data
as objects append informated metadata
tags to your data and generate inventory
reports throughout the remainder of this
video I will cover how to append tags to
your objects how to generate inventory
reports for your data and show some
sample use cases so let's dive right in
all the s3 customers can use object tags
to create different ways to manage their
data object tags a unique key value
pairs that are applied to individual s3
objects they can be created updated or
deleted at any time during the life of
an s3 objects and up to 10 unique tags
can be appended to a single s3 object
you can use object tags to add details
to your objects such as data owners and
users department or business unit media
type data format or security
classification
after tagging your objects you can use
access control lists to restrict access
to data with specific tags replicate
objects to other AWS regions group
objects with unique business compliance
or product tags and create lifecycle
policies for objects with specific tags
and move them to other s3 storage
classes as access patterns change
[Music]
another management feature is s3
inventory with s2 inventory you can
generate reports that lists all the
objects in a specific s3 bucket or share
a prefix these reports include
corresponding metadata such as key names
latest modification dates object size
storage cloths the application or
encryption status among other properties
s3 inventory reports can be delivered
daily or weekly and can be encrypted to
protect sensitive data it can also be
configured to deliver multiple reports
that list different types of metadata
that are relevant to your specific needs
some common use cases for s2 inventory
includes auditing the encryption status
of your objects for security and
compliance purposes tracking the
replication status of objects to another
AWS region speeding up business
workflows and Big Data jobs and
identifying target objects for s3 batch
operations thank you for watching and
stay tuned to learn more about Amazon's
s3 cross region replication capabilities
and object versioning tools for more
information on Amazon s3 please visit
our website
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
